sentence_a: The lumberjack left his axe sticking in the top of the stump after winning the axe toss.
sentence_b: The lumberjack left his axe sticking in the side of the stump after winning the axe toss.

sentence_a: Derek swung his bat as the ball approached.
sentence_b: Derek held his bat high as the ball approached.

sentence_a: The librarian put the book back on the table.
sentence_b: The librarian put the book back on the shelf.

sentence_a: Jessica stuck the bottle in the wine rack, anticipating a romantic evening.
sentence_b: Jessica stuck the bottle in the ice, anticipating a romantic evening.

sentence_a: James placed the bowl into an open space in the cabinet.
sentence_b: James placed the bowl into an open slot in the dishwasher.

sentence_a: Janie grabbed the broom and rode it around the house, pretending it was her horse.
sentence_b: Janie grabbed the broom and swept the house, pretending she was Cinderella.

sentence_a: The teenager placed her brush in the bottom of her bag, looking forward to the party.
sentence_b: The teenager held her brush up like a microphone, pretending to be a famous rock star.

sentence_a: The toddler drew a kitty cat with his crayon on his bedroom door.
sentence_b: The toddler drew a kitty cat with his crayon on his bedroom floor.

sentence_a: Laura threw the decoration in the drawer with the clothespin.
sentence_b: Laura hung the decoration on the line with the clothespin.

sentence_a: The hunter shone the flashlight into the mouth of the cavern.
sentence_b: The hunter shone the flashlight onto the floor of the cavern.

sentence_a: The race car driver fastened the fire-extinguisher under his seat.
sentence_b: The race car driver fastened the fire-extinguisher onto the garage wall.

sentence_a: The waiter knocked over the wineglass while admiring Maureen's gown.
sentence_b: The waiter filled the wineglass while admiring Maureen's gown.

sentence_a: Mick strummed his guitar as he warmed up for the concert.
sentence_b: Mick set his guitar on the rack as he warmed up for the concert.

sentence_a: Annie raised the gun to fire at the target.
sentence_b: Annie lowered the gun to place it in the holster.

sentence_a: Frank pressed the iron onto his pants, hoping he wouldn't be late.
sentence_b: Frank placed the iron onto the shelf, hoping he wouldn't be late.

sentence_a: The lab assistant put the key to the monkey cage in the lock.
sentence_b: The lab assistant put the key to the monkey cage on the hook.

sentence_a: The carpenter hammered the nail into the wall.
sentence_b: The carpenter hammered the nail into the floor plank.

sentence_a: The accountant stuck his pen behind his ear.
sentence_b: The accountant stuck his pen into his pocket protector.

sentence_a: Rick hurriedly stuck his pencil in the desk drawer.
sentence_b: Rick hurriedly stuck his pencil in the coffee mug.

sentence_a: Sara situated the expensive plate on its mat on the table.
sentence_b: Sara situated the expensive plate on its holder on the shelf.

sentence_a: The anxious little boy knocked the salt shaker over onto the table.
sentence_b: The anxious little boy placed the salt shaker onto the table.

sentence_a: Becca used the scissors to carve her initials into the tree.
sentence_b: Becca used the scissors to carve her initials into the wet concrete.
explicit_a: The pair of scissors was horizontal.
explicit_b: The pair of scissors was vertical.

sentence_a: Jim prepared to insert the screw into the side of the cabinet.
sentence_b: Jim prepared to insert the screw into the top of the cabinet.

sentence_a: The young husband prepared to place the spare tire into the trunk.
sentence_b: The young husband prepared to place the spare tire onto the wheel.
